gitlens.ai.generateCommitMessage.customI: Create a short, concise commit message focusing on the main action taken. Use active voice and avoid unnecessary details in the title. If further details are needed, add them to the body of the commit (1 empty line between title and body). The message should be in the form: '<feat|chore|fix>: <summary>'. Keep the summary under 72 characters when possible and focus on what was added, removed, or changed rather than technical implementation details. Use lowercase for both the type and the first letter of the summary. Use imperative mood for the summary - write as if giving a command. Use 'add', 'fix', 'update', 'remove' (NOT 'adds', 'fixes', 'updates', 'removes'). Always include specific context about which system, file, or location was modified (e.g., 'in vscode settings', 'in package.json', 'to dockerfile'). Be specific rather than generic. Carefully examine the actual code changes to accurately describe what was modified - look at the specific property names, file paths, and values being changed rather than assuming the purpose.
